com.example.yunita.tradiogc.photo

Class Photo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.yunita.tradiogc.photo.Photo

  • public class Photo
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines photos of an item.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Photo()
      Class constructor for photos.
      Photo(int itemId)
      Class constructor specifying the details of photos.

      Adds an encoded photo to an item's list of photos.

      Decodes the photo from a string into a photo and returns it.

      Encodes the photo into a string and returns it.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getEncodedPhoto()
      Gets the array list of encoded photos of an item.

      Gets the id of the item that the photos belong to.

      Removes an encoded photo from an item's list of photos.

      • encodeImage

        public java.lang.String encodeImage(android.graphics.Bitmap photo)
        Encodes the photo into a string and returns it. Code taken from: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9768611/encode-and-decode-bitmap-object-in-base64-string-in-android (C) 2015 Roman Truba, modified by Cloud9
        Parameters:
        photo - photo taken from camera
        Returns:
        encodedImage image that has been encoded into a string byte array

        Decodes the photo from a string into a photo and returns it.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        decodedByte decoded Bitmap photo
